Reviews.Title: “An adequate place to stay with school groups”
Reviews.Author: MJJRJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a party of 42 6th form students in March. Our expectations were not good due to trip advisor reviews, however the hotel proved us wrong and more importantly we found no evidence of bed bugs!. The students rated the acommodation, even though some rooms were cramped with 4 beds in them. They liked the bathrooms, which were functional and clean, use of the safe and sky sports on the TV in the bedrooms. The Hotel is in a good location, handy for walking to the various sights. Breakfast was adequate and kept the students fuelled for the long days sightseeing. The only issue we had was with other school parties who were less well behaved. This is not a hotel for a relaxing peacful break with a loved one. However it does cater for large groups efficiently.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravels-PL-UK
Reviews.Content: The other all location of this hotel is good as it is close to mainly anything you might need : metro , bus stops , shops and the cultural sights. You can take a short walk to the big park ''Villa Borghese'' which is near the river . You are also a few streets away from many cultural sights. The Bedroom: A bit dissapointed with this as the beds are quite small and all the furniture does not match the other things . There are bed lights at each side of the bed which work well , aswell as the main lamp which did not really give out much light.There is a very small television - more than a computer monitor . There is a small desk which the television is on aswell as again two lamps on each side of the desk because the rooom is quite dark where we stayed in . The room is quite small and there is little space you can relax in the evening. There are also weird painting on the wall which we hated. Bathroom: There is a small sink with a mirrow above it , a toilet right next to it . There is a bath with a shower - better watch how you get in if you do not want to fall and hurt yourself. There also is a radiator to dry your towels on if you need to . Again there is not alot of space.They change your towels and rest of the linen and things nearly everyday. Over all if you want a good relaxing and spacious hotel do not stay there but if you go out and enjoy your cultural holiday to see the Colloseum , Spanish Stairs or The Vatican City , go there and enjoy your stay like we did - but I would not really come back to Noto Hotel , but I would love to come again to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for groups at a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Albert047
Reviews.Content: Every year we organise a cultural trip to Italy with our 6th grade (17 year olds). Through the years I have seen the inside of several hotels that specialize in accommodating groups. I have to say that I was pleasantly suprised when I arrived at Hotel Noto last week. This hotel exceeds most hotels that host large parties. Our group counted over 30 pupils and we all got a room on the 3rd floor of the hotel. The rooms are not very spacy, but very clean and pleasant. The beds are comfortable. The bathrooms are also very clean and comfortable (although some of our students had trouble with the plumbing in their room).The staff is most welcoming and professional. Especially the breakfast buffet is a great asset of this hotel; there is an abundance in choice and the buffet is very well organised by the staff that keeps an eye on everything so that nothing ever runs out. The breakfast area is spacy and can easily cope with groups having breakfast at the same time. At check out the rooms are checked swiftly and correctly. To be brief, we will certainly stay at Hotel Noto again when returning to Rome with a bunch of students. As an private person this hotel would not be my first choice, because hotels of this kind are very often too crowded and noisy to my liking. However, it would not be dramatic to stay here because the hotel is quite sound proof. I also want to stress that the several bad reviews on this site are -according to me- no correct reflection of this hotel's qualities. You can do a lot worse in Italy/Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, clean and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Simon C
Reviews.Content: I recently enjoyed a few nights at the Hotel Noto. The room was absolutely fine - clean linen every day, clean room and bathroom, friendly staff, a good breakfast, an efficiently organised and neatly run hotel. The location is excellent for the main train station in Rome (Termini), which is also the only crossing point of the 2 metro lines crossing the city. It is not badly located either in terms of walking to a lot of the sights - the Colosseum, Circo Massimo, the Forum - and if you are energetic you really don't need public transport from here to almost anywhere. You can also walk to the Trevi fountain, the Piazza Navona and the Spanish steps from here. The Vatican museum is worth taking a cheap metro to (Termini to Cipri) as this is a bit further away. The Hotel is set back from the main road and is pretty quiet. A number of school groups use this and is obviously a good, safe and well organised hotel for them to do this. The decor is relatively new and the TV's in each room are pretty new with SKY as well (which you have to pay for). The lobby is well lit with 24 hour security and the staff were efficient without being brusque. The breakfast room(s) are clean and bright and, again, well organised for getting through a lot of guests. Fare is bread rolls, jams, ham, cheese, sweet croissants, coffee and fruit juice as well as fruit. Fine to set you up for the day. There are 3 lifts, which are a bit slow but functional. The corridors are all marble and the rooms are decorated with prints and mirrors. I couldn't find anything to complain about - some previous reviewers must be used to 5* hotels and their reviews didn't seem to match what the hotel offers at all. For Rome this is a moderately priced, clean, functional, well located and safe option.

Reviews.Title: “Functional, clean and good value, recommended.”
Reviews.Author: 1980MRC
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the hotel Noto as a teacher on a school trip. The rooms were clean, well maintained and the beds were comfortable. The hotel is well run and the staff were pleasant. I had no complaints and would happily recommend this hotel to other school groups. I'm not sure if I'd be as keen to stay at the Noto if I wasn't part of a school party.

Reviews.Title: “Mousolini's blanket”
Reviews.Author: efi m
Reviews.Content: It was the most terrible hotel I have ever visited in my life!!!! O.M.G!!!!!!!!!! Don't go for any reason!!! The place next to rabish is more clean!!!

Reviews.Title: “WARNING* BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: spence56033
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a night and my god, it was like sleeping in mudhut back in Kenya (no offence.) The beds were like rocks. I slept for about 1hour max. The staff were about as friendly as Jabba the hut from Star Wars. Not only were they the problems, I also managed to find bed bugs crawling around down below.

Reviews.Title: “This is a VERY GOOD place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Iain P
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from a school trip to Rome and Sorrento, organised through NST in the UK. We were a group of 40 senior pupils and 4 teachers. Before going, many of my pupils and indeed myself had been worried by the many negative comments on this website about the Noto. As things turned out we found them to be completely misleading. It seems to me that either the hotel has either had a complete turnaround in standards very recently or the judgement of some of the complainants has to be questioned. All the rooms I saw were very clean, all the sheets and towels were clean too. There was no evidence of bugs of any sort. The staff were friendly and helpful both to staff and pupils. Breakfast was the typical stuff you would expect in a hotel at this price. Juice, coffee (admittedly it was from a machine and wasn't great), cheese, meats, cereal, those chewy, morning rolls that you get throughout Italy, some spreads and a few slices of cake. My pupils, who are more used to cereal, or even, stereotypically for us, porridge, were a little wary on day one but were eating piles of the stuff the following morning. Incidentally there seemed to be plenty of tables - there are several breakfast rooms and, early on, as one is filled the lights go on in the next one and so on. Staff were careful to point us in the right direction. There were several school trips staying as well as ourselves and 'real' people. School trips were asked to book a time for breakfast to make seating easier. Breakfast was served from 7-10. It all worked fine. We did spot a few things about the rooms we needed fixed, such as that a couple of the safes weren't working and a few of the electrical fittings needed to be more securely fastened to the wall. We raised this at the front desk fairly late on the first night and someone came to fix most things the next day. We did have a problem with noise from another school party but I spoke to the hotel staff and then the teachers of the group concerned and it was stopped pretty quickly. Teachers are pretty good at that. We occupied 15 rooms and some were a little full with 4 people, two on smaller, portable beds - but not camp beds or fold out beds. Perhaps other rooms were in the state that others describe but I did walk around most of the building and did not pick up any bad or worrying smells. The rooms were furnished to a good standard, beds comfortable and no one complained of trouble sleeping. Bathrooms were fine too, although be prepared for no shower curtains or fittings for one. The whole room is tiled and there is a drain in the floor. Not what I was used to but it worked well. The Noto is very handy for Termini station (and Republica on Linea A if you go the other way round the Baths of Diocletian and want a simpler station to navigate). Our party of 44, by then very tired, managed to walk from the Trevi fountain back to the Noto in about 30 minutes. Going slowly. If I was in Rome to live like an emperor, away from the hustle and bustle of the city, I would pay more and stay somewhere else. If I was looking for a reasonably priced, comfortable and friendly hotel, handy for the sights, in an area with plenty of restaurants, cafes (a very good one down the road to Termini) and bars I would have no problem with staying at the Noto again.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, old furnishings”
Reviews.Author: Samantha T
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very near the Roma Termini Station, about 5 mins walk. 20 mins from the city centre if you know how to walk. Near to some kebab stall, pizzerias and a convenient store. The neighbourhood is slightly dodgy in the evening as there are some dubious characters hanging out in the bar opposite the hotel. We have stayed in both Hotel Siracusa and Hotel Noto, given a choice, we'll stick to Siracusa for the location (room size n furnishings are on par though)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel NOGO is more like it...”
Reviews.Author: W P
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for about three days at the end of September 2011. It was a HORRIBLE experience! The hotel has not been maintained well (age wise) and is just generally dirty. The bathrooms are full of mold and mildew, which makes them smell terrible and left us ill, literally. The staff is, at best, wholly disinterested and, at worst, outright rude. Particularly the gentleman who works the front desk overnight. He is generally pretty crabby if you dare to wake him from midnight naps on the lobby sofas! The hotel does have free wifi but only in the lobby and it is turned off from 11pm-8 or 9am every night. While staying at this horrible hotel, my mother fell from an unmarked step and we had to take her to the emergency room where she was treated for a sprained knee and a fractured finger (she had to have a pin put in the finger when we returned to the States). Two other women in our traveling party almost tripped over the same step. When the husband of one the women talked to the front desk staff about the step (just as we did when my mother fell) the staff told him that the manager of the hotel knew about the step but simply refused to mark it so that it would be more visible to people walking down the hallway. Only a day later, another older woman who used a cane when walking fell over the same step!!!!!!! The staff still refused to mark it!!!!!!!!! Also, when my mother fell I went to the front desk to ask for ice for her knee and was told that the hotel did not carry ice and I would have to walk around to some of the local corner bars and ask for ice there. I went to three different bars before a restaurant finally agreed to give me less than a cup full of ice. Having walked around the neighborhood looking for ice, I can say with confidence that while centrally located (i.e. near the train station) this hotel is NOT in the best area. It quickly became clear that, as a young woman, I did not need to be walking around the neighborhood by myself whether it was day or night. Finally, the hotel does offer breakfast but this includes old stale pastries, rotten fruit and room temperature milk and water (which makes sense since the hotel doesn't have ice!) and "fruit" juice that close to Kool-Aid than Tropicana. This hotel bills itself as centrally located and affordable. And, I know it is tempting to think you won't spend much time in the hotel since you will be out experiencing lovely Rome but the little bit of time you do spend in your dirty and moldy hotel room will be too much. Save yourself the grief and the bad Trip Advisor rating and STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!

Reviews.Title: “Enough to sleep at night”
Reviews.Author: Sunny20111
Reviews.Content: We were on a tour and stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. I was lucky because my single room was big enough in comparison with the others. Breakfasts are simple and there are very few tables so you should come earlier to sit down. Seems like a typical old Rome hotel. But of course it's location is great, very close to the center, to Termini station, to Underground. Nearly 15 min walk to the Colosseum. We spent here only nights and it was enough.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: Liberty72
Reviews.Content: I can't even begin to express how bad this hotel is. A relative fell in the hallway. Staff never bothered to ask if she was ok even though we had to take her to hospital. We were told later that management knew others had fallen in the same place and simply did not care. Bathrooms are truly appalling with mold everywhere, which made us sick. Water from upstairs ran through the light fixtures from the upstairs rooms. I could go on. . . Run! - don't walk from this disgusting, run-down un-clean "estashplishment."

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: YourWorldTraveler123
Reviews.Content: We were on the Contiki Italian Espresso tour in September 2011 and the hotel had a nice location near the Train Terminal but the breakfast was very slim pickings and the guestroom bathroom had bold on the vinyl. A decent hotel which we spent limited time in because of our intense daily agenda.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly but central.”
Reviews.Author: Jeff_Cheong
Reviews.Content: First of all. The room smells - upon entering I'm greeted with a smell similar to the likes of a wet rag which has been sitting in dirty laundry for the past couple of days. If you can get over that, the place is very central, has a bed, running water, lights/electricity and is close to all amenities such as a dry cleaner, convenient stores and the metro/termini station (central station) Not the most romantic place but rather a place to crash with mates going for a trip away in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't even deserve stars”
Reviews.Author: Rich120
Reviews.Content: This hotel (if you can call it that) derives the majority of it's business from group bookings - it's a wonder they are open at all! Front desk service consists of a corpse with a pulse, AC is not working, not all rooms have safes. On a positive note the coffee machine at breakfast is good, but they never replenish the meats and vegetable trays. If you want to eat, get there early!!

Reviews.Title: “One simple word... TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: Tolgay
Reviews.Content: We just checked into this terrible hotel via our lovely travel agency Jolly Tour/Turkey. What an outstanding terrible hotel. Uncomfortable room, basin was not functional, TV was out of order, beds were like a flat wood. Most important the room was not clean at all. Do not even go closer. We immediately checked out without even staying 1 night and found a 2 stars hotel (Piave) nearby which is much more comfortable by all means from this so called 4 stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Was not as bad as the other reviews.”
Reviews.Author: Aquangel3
Reviews.Content: There were no bed bugs. Hotels in Europe are different then hotels in the states, for a cheap place it's not bad . I was nervous but it was ok

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE read before you book”
Reviews.Author: tyneal h
Reviews.Content: hotel noto is in a relatively good location close to the central station and no more than 10 minutes walk to main attractions such as colosseum and the trvie fountain, however there are other qualities that need to be considered such as 1° Elevators constantly breaking down this happened to me on 2 occasions both times it was very hot and there was no airconditioning it was a very scary ordeal and little to no exèplanation was given by staff as to why they kept breaking down 2° Hotel rooms are very small and along with being no bigger than a shoe box the beds had obviously not had their linen changed because there was food and obvious sweat stains and long black hairs all throughout the bed 3° the air conditioning did not work and was constantly stuck on 26 degrees celcius and even though staff were repeatedly asked to address the problem nothing was done to fix it 4° on the second last day hosukeeping neglected to clean the bathrooms, the beds were made but towels were not replaced and neither was the toilet paper and when i went to front reception to ask for more toilet paper it took 20 mintues for 2 people to actually locate any!!!!!! 5° Also the showers dont have any screens as such so flooding the bathroom is inevitable.... be careful 6° breakfast was included in the total price of the accomidation and the selection was extremlely small and quality was very very average on a few occasions myself and my friends purchased breakfast outside of the hotel 7° be careful not to lock yourself out of the rooms as when you ask for help at reception all they can do is ask that you keep knocking on your door in the hope that your room mate is already inside..... basically they were not intrestedf in producing a master key to let me into my room but merely shrugged there shoulders!!!!! Hotel noto is budget accomidation and is good if you are looking for somewhere cheap but out of a 14 day holiday staying at 5 different hotels this was by far the worst and i will never ever go back and strongly recommend that everyone else reads this review and stays away from this derelict hotel with unintrested staff and extremely poor customer service!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “ok...”
Reviews.Author: tkkjz
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Noto for 3 nights with a school group. The location is very good, not far at all from Termini rail station and metro. Also near the plaza del republicca, which was beautiful at night. The rooms are very small and quite cramped. There was no walkable space between 3 of the beds. The mattresses are quite hard and the bedding looks a bit aged- along with the decoration in the rooms and the rest of the hotel in general. The bathrooms are averagely clean, and the shower was powerful, although no shower curtain. The breakfast I wouldnt really call a buffet breakfast as very little was available. Breads, hams, cheeses, yogurts, fruit and some diluted fruit juices. The staff were friendly and helpful. Alot of schools stay at this hotel, and for the second and third night there would quite often be people yelling down the hallways and running up and down the stairs, so if you like to be in quiet, this hotel isn't for you. Overall an average hotel for the price and good for school trips because of its great location, shame about the tiny rooms though.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about it! Worst hotel i've stayed abroad...”
Reviews.Author: JollyTurMagduru
Reviews.Content: Noto Hotel Rome can't even be 3 stars. Don't believe the fake 4 stars because rooms are very dirty; both the rooms and the hotel smells so bad, tv in the room doesnt work, the hotel doesnt have a restaurant/bar, etc.... Hotel Noto Rome can only be a motel for students at D class. We traveled to Rome with a local Turkish tour and the agency selected this hotel. When we saw our room, we demanded to change it cause the room was so dirty and small. The bed was not king size, there were two seperate beds and one of them was broken! We've changed 3 rooms, and after we saw the 3rd room was also awful, we moved to another hotel. Don't stay at Hotel Noto for your own peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed. Dirty, bad smell, bugs everywhere...”
Reviews.Author: carpe37
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Rome with a tour, and the agency told us that the hotel is a 4 star hotel but it can't be a 4 star hotel... The rooms were too small, very dirty and smell very bad. There were dust and bugs everywhere, we couldn't sleep because of the bad smell of the pillows and blankets. There were no curtains on the shower. They change the bed sheets once in 4 days. Breakfast was awful. Everything is bad about this hotel, guys if you are planning to go to this hotel and if you are planning your trip with a tour agency like Jolly Tours don't trust them and please think twice...

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs... yup... that's right BED BUGS!!!”
Reviews.Author: sonrisazu3
Reviews.Content: I was traveling for leisure with a family, an older woman, her daughter, and her granddaughter (who was 6). The rooms smelled like mildew, and the mattresses just felt damp. There were no curtains on the shower, so the water spilled out onto the floor, making things even more damp in the room. There were most definitely bed bugs in the room which kept us from sleeping well, and 2 of my travel companions ended up with bites all over (one of them being the little girl). When we called to complain after the first night, and they did come in and change the sheets on the beds. On the second night, when the problem wasn't any better, we called to complain again, and the hotel staff made us feel like it was OUR fault for not asking to switch rooms after the first night! The location is good, that is for sure, but I wouldn't recommend this hotel to ANYONE.

Reviews.Title: “Alright guys”
Reviews.Author: helenmelons
Reviews.Content: I came on a school trip and from reviews was very worried. However I had a pleasant stay. The rooms were pretty small but manageable with a bathroom and everything was CLEAN! woop! WE were provided with fresh towels and maids every morning came to sort out the rooms. We did have a balcony though it looked out onto the hotel tip but it didnt matter that much and was quite relaxed. We had a tv which worked but had no channels, but who goes on holiday to watch tv? The shower was awsome, was like a power shower and rooms were secured nicely. The breakfast was not amazingly awful but it wasnt good either however the food at the resteraunt in which they give you ur evening meals at was better but still wasnt that good but for a few nights stay its alirhgt n you can get 75C slices of pizza at the supermarket a few ticks aways if ur not happy. They did have very nice puddings but the spagetti with quid didnt go down very well with some of us. The only major downfall was that there were other ude students and teachers that went and distrubed others throughout the night as they were running about and knocking on doors. the receptionist said "im not a baby sitter" but a bouncer man did come up and see to them though they continued . Obviously this is not a place for those wanting luxury but if you want a budget stay and you happy with the basics, comfy, clean and secure, id say wulla this hotel will be okay for you . The stations were near by for transport which was brilliant! they were about a 3 minute walk away. Wouldnt really recommnd for a nice family holiday or a couples get away. Mainly for students or adults who are just there for a few days and trying to keep costs down and of course school trips. To be honest i went in 2010 and I think they have improved the servicessince 2004 and 6 etc

Reviews.Title: “Good location but stay away if you value your sleep”
Reviews.Author: Armstronski
Reviews.Content: Took a Sixth Form group to Rome on a Religious Studies trip for three nights. First impressions of the hotel were positive. Check in for the large group of students was quick and simple. The location was also ideal for exploring Rome. Rooms were small but adequate for a short stay and on the whole clean. The problems only really began at night. There were several school groups staying in the hotel from various countries. On the first night after a long day travelling we were keen to get to sleep before midnight for a long tour of the Vatican the next day. The noise and behaviour from the Spanish groups was totally unbelievable. They were running up and down corridors, knocking on doors, smoking weed on the corridors, groping eachother, prank calling and generally being abusive to myself and other staff with our party. I asked at reception 3 times for something to be done and was simply told that there was nothing they could do as it was the responsibility of the teachers with the groups. This would be fine if teachers from Spain were prepared to take any responsibility for the behaviour of their groups. I had to find the number rooms of the teachers and knock for them to speak to their groups and not one member of staff answered. The teachers were even more rude than the students, refusing to address the behaviour. One teacher forcing his hand in my face when I dared to tell him that he needed to do something about the chaos his group were causing. At 3am after no sleep I finally rang our NST rep who phoned the hotel simply to be told that there was nothing they could do. The receptionist barely even acknowledged me and continued to smoke his cigar whilst chaos continued all around. This was repeated three nights in a row to the extent that none of us had more than about ten hours sleep in 72 hours. Why would a hotel continue to accept school groups from a country where the teachers are not expected to discipline the children in their care? Simply not good enough when it comes to dealing with groups. On the second and third night a different receptionist did try to address the problem by threatening the groups with the police but still the noise continued. On the whole, good trip but I could never return to this hotel with another group unless they are willing to take some responsibility for what happens under their roof. British kids should be very proud of their behaviour which from all schools staying at the time was immaculate in comparison to the rude and obnoxious manner of both the Spanish teachers and pupils. Totally shocking.

Reviews.Title: “stay away.”
Reviews.Author: pinkmaggot
Reviews.Content: we've been there for 3 nights.the room was too small,not clean,tv was broken,breakfast was bad,there was too much noise at night coming from the street and the students staying at the hotel.Wouldnt stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “It is good”
Reviews.Author: mpsflu
Reviews.Content: I had no problem in Noto Hotel. The location is perfect, the rooms are clean and the price is low. I really recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars!!! No way!”
Reviews.Author: naylovesu
Reviews.Content: Ok the staff was nice, theres was a lift thank goodness. I was enjoying it so far until i walked into my room. I was sharing with two other people. We had been put in a double room but a camp bed had been stuffed in. There was no place to walk. There was so much uneeded furniture. The bathroom was small but clean. That was a good point everything was clean. When going around to other peoples rooms i found that some where big and spacious and others wernt, its just what i laned with. Its great fun if your with your friends, if you aint then forget it. The location was fantasic though just a 5 minute walk to the station which takes you to all the hot spots, spanish steps , vatican, everything! Theres no food in the hotel, but nice resturants in the station, which is not what you thing. Its more like a huge shopping centre with underground, underground! So yes this hotel is good if you are doing stuff during the day but if you want to be stuck in a hotel all day this is a bad one.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for School Trips”
Reviews.Author: Amigos4life
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned after the negative reviews given to the Noto; however I took a school party from London to stay there and found it to be quite adequate for students. Bedrooms were a little cramped, but the students didn't seem to mind. Maid service and clean towels every day. Breakfast fine - cereals, juices, hot/cold beverages,; cold meats and cheeses etc. More than sufficient. Very central to all main 'sights'. Quite a busy area, but overall our party found it quite safe. I would certainly recommend this hotel for school parties. Staff were quite helpful overall.

Reviews.Title: “Not great...”
Reviews.Author: Onofrius
Reviews.Content: I took a school party to Rome and stayed here. It certainly isn't four stars, and I wouldn't stay here myself, but it was adequate for a group of boys. The rooms were very cramped and essentially windowless (though I think I was particularly unlucky in this), the lights flickered ominously and the shower lacked a curtain. Breakfast was the usual mundane Roman affair, though by no means the worst I have had in Italy. The location is pretty good - just a few minutes from Termini, and very close to the airport buses. So, if you're taking a school party, it'll be just about adequate, but otherwise avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Oh NO!”
Reviews.Author: Onward64
Reviews.Content: Despite its claim to be 4-star, it does nothing more than tick boxes (such as 24 hour desk service) without making any attempt to offer a 4-star hotel. This hotel makes its money by renting to large school groups. In other words the place is bedlam. Students run up and down hallways and stairwells screaming and banging doors. When I phoned reception, they said that they would contact the teachers. At midnight, when the noise had not abated, I went down to the desk to complain in person. The desk clerk shrugged and said, 'The teachers have gone out. What can I do?' It was nearly 1am when they returned and told their students to go to bed. My room was incredibly small. The bed ran along one length of the wall and then a narrow passage along the other. All up, the room could not have been 1.5 metres wide. The walls were paper thin. I found out things I didn't want to know from the teenage girls next door. In other rooms, our group indicated that when you pulled out the plug in the bath, the water gushed up the floor waste and flowed into the room. The desk staff refused to believe it and insisted that it was the fault of the occupants. "They should have let the water out a little at a time!" In the end I started to feel sorry for the staff. Imagine working in a place where people were either running riot or tearing their hair out. It takes courage to say to a tired, angry traveller at 1am, "Are there any other problems that you'd like me to pretend don't exist." I can't tell what an appalling hotel this is. It's only redeming feature is that it is conveniently located near the station.

Reviews.Title: “In my 30 years of travel this was by far the worse hotel I ever stayed in .”
Reviews.Author: Rocky626
Reviews.Content: This was by far the worse hotel I have ever stayed in during my 30 years of travel. Where we were located, there was no elevator to that area and the area was entered through one door in the hallway. In case of fire we would all have been killed. The air did not work, the room was filled with bugs and the area was the worse part of Rome. The breafast was nothing to write home about and of the 3 elevators only one worked part of the time. The bathroom had a shower head in the middle of the room which poured water all over the bathroom and into the bedroom. At times, there was no water at all. The rooms were very small. When used as a triple, luggage would have t o be stored in the bathroom. The desk was antipatica and rude. Stay away from this place!

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe everything you read.”
Reviews.Author: virtute
Reviews.Content: I too was worried when the school group I was leading was booked for five nights in the Noto. The reviews had the students and their parents, I might add, concerned. Well, the Noto was way better than all of the reviews. Yes it is old, rooms aren't oversized, but you cannot beat the location!! The AC worked just fine and the rooms were clean. There is a charming street market behind the hotel and many low priced cafes in the neighborhood. The hotel caters to big groups, so it can be noisy, but no one had a hard time sleeping. Breakfast buffet was more than adequate. Someone mentioned the staff was rude. Nothing cold have been further from my experience: they were efficient, helpful and quite accommodating. They handled a wake up call for 4 am, and made reservations for us for the Villa Borghesi. Some staff were not fluent in English, but we are in Italy after all. If I weren't traveling with a group I would choose something more upscale, but I will actually request the Noto for my next school trip. D O'D, Santa Barbara, CA

Reviews.Title: “Useful place for student trip”
Reviews.Author: DoogLondon
Reviews.Content: The other reviews filled me with trepidation, but I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The rooms were clean the a/c worked, room size was adequate. The hotel is ideally situated for a student trip with the metro station at Termini serving both lines. Staff were fine. Breakfast was the usual dull fare. I have visited Rome with and without students on numerous occasions and although I would not stay at this hotel if I was just on holiday (mainly because of the noise from British teenage students) I would strongly recommend it for school trips.

Reviews.Title: “The worst I'v ever seen.”
Reviews.Author: osophied
Reviews.Content: This is advertised as a 4 star Hotel. It does not have a Bar or a Restaurant. Guests cannot get as much as a cup of Coffee in the place. The rooms are tiny. TV did not work. Never Again. In any other western country this establishment would not have hotel status.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: annasphere
Reviews.Content: This hotel may have been worth four stars about 50 years ago: there was lovely ebenistry work in our room. From all other aspects, this hotel has little to write home about: 1. An indifferent receptionist: possibly a Russian guy because of an influx of Russian schoolchildren during our New Year stay. No smile, poor knowledge of English, worst of all, no willingness to help, seemingly little knowledge about Rome. 2. The main dining room: peeling yellow paint throughout. 3. The breakfast: a railway station style -- coffee from a machine, chewy bread rolls, boring cold cuts..... 4. One of three (small) elevators not working for the full three days of our stay. 5. In the room: bedside light hanging upside down, the bidet apparatus not working at first. 6. No decent TV channels (doesn't matter when you're in Rome). 7. On the positive side: the location is quite central, the hotel was very clean, the lobby is fine.

Reviews.Title: “terrible service”
Reviews.Author: 2w
Reviews.Content: the day we arrived the receptionist was eating pizza and the day we left other two ones were having an ice cream at the reception. I even saw them later "resting " on the sofa by the reception as I was waiting for our guide. Nobody spoke a word in English so I had to manage with my Spanish-Italian dialect. The safe did not work in the roon, the lights in the bathroom flashed all the time and the extra bed was more than unconfortable.Of course nobody did anything about it even when we complained everyday. The only person that helped a little and at least smiled to us (I even would say she was the only one that worked there) was the houskeeper in the mornings. Location is quite ok, but for sure I wont even think about coming back there.

Reviews.Title: “Noto is "No Go"”
Reviews.Author: KPB1
Reviews.Content: We were redirected to the Hotel Noto, after originally booking at the Archimede Hotel, and arriving to find that our room was flooded. We were told that the Noto was 4 star, but I think they must do the star rating themselves! The door to our room was all scratched up, the window opened to a back alley, and some big metal chimneys, which looked like a mini nuclear reactor, the bathroom was dark, tiny and had mould around the window, and the shower flooded the whole bathroom. The air conditioner didn't work, and we were told that it didn't come on until five o'clock, however, nothing changed at five o'clock! The TV remote didn't work and the surfaces of the bedside tables and TV bench were dirty, and looked like they had never even been wiped over. On complaining, they reluctantly moved us to a slightly better room, on our second day - at least it had a proper shower screen. Generally, the front desk staff were unhelpful, and avoided eye contact as you came into the lobby. Breakfast was pretty awful - very dry bread and fruit which had seen better days. This hotel is walking distance to Rome Termini, which is convenient, but that is the only positive thing I can say about it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Good Location, Fine Decor For Student Tour Groups”
Reviews.Author: jakirkman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Noto for 3 nights in February 2006 with 40 of my students on a European trip and I could not agree less with most of the reviews on this hotel. Here is my brief review: The hotel is in a central Rome location close to Termini. The rooms are tastefully decorated. The hotel caters mainly to student tour groups. It can be noisy The hotel is VERY clean. The breakfast is adequate. The bathrooms are small but marble and clean. The single rooms are tiny Triple rooms are just fine for students with one bed per person. Each person in each room must leave a KEY DEPOSIT of 10 Euros upon checkin. Front desk will require passport information for all students. This hotel is affiliated with the Siracusa on the other siide of Termini. I have no idea about rates as I was with as student travel group.

Reviews.Title: “Overcrowded and Overrated!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to the Hotel Noto with my school this april. We were told a nice 4 star hotel and when we pulled up to it and were led down a seedy alley we thought "oh no!!!!", this impression was enhanced by the sight of the tacky and broken sign above the hotel. But then we all thought we were wrong when we entered the lobby. It was all marble and lovely fittings and fixtures. But the minute we got to our rooms we knew that the hotel was after all overrated! The room was clearly a double room, and a small one at that (the head board was still attached to the wall). But in this tiny double there was 5 beds crammed in. To get up in the morning we had to climb over each other in order to reach the bathroom and pile our suitcases as best we could in the cupboard, under beds and even one in the bathroom. The bathroom was adaquete although the toilet seat was cracked and there was no shower curtains. The tv, fridge and the safe didn't work and the door looked as if someone had tried to batter it down. Breakfast was reasonable, although the bread was a bit stale. The only real benefit was its close vicinity to the Termini Station. So overall OVERCROWDED and OVERRATED, worth nothing like 4 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really bad, we stayed in the hotel on a school trip the first week of Easter. The station was not far from the hotel which was convienient as it was a very boring place to stay. The television had very few channels and none of the few were English speaking. The reception was terrible on the channels which were 'receieved'. The shower-head attached to a mixer bath-tap was positioned so that you couldn't have a shower standing up without flooding the room. The air-conditioning didn't work as it blew out hot air on all of its settings. The refridgerator worked OK but switched off when you shut the door. We had four single beds squidged into our one double-bed sized room and had a poor view out of the window. There is a restaurant/bar opposite the hotel and a loud racket can be heard from the room if you're facing onto the street. The shutters didn't close properly in our room and the window wouldn't work properly either. The plug-point behind the TV was lose and coming away from the wall, when the lights were turned off, the socket also turned off which was quite inconvienient when trying to watch TV in bed. The extractor fan switch in the bathroom did nothing and we also suffered a power-cut. There was plenty out for breakfast but unfortunately the bread was chewwy-stale, and the orange juice was so strong it was foul. The staff were very pleasant but unfortunately the hotel itself let the place in general down; a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice people and good location”
Reviews.Author: amit2006
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and I really enjoy the location near the main monuments. The station close by avoid to spend money in costly cab.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome holiday”
Reviews.Author: CanadaMonique
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a 7 day vacation, in Rome Italy, in June 2005, it ws a quaint little hotel in downtown Rome, it was clean, great service, excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel for four nights with a school group and i have to say the shower facilities were appaling. the shower itself was in the middle of the bathroom so when you showered every single thing in the bathroom got wet! you couldnt even bring your towels in with you. there is no way i would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: MrJohn
Reviews.Content: Stayed in September 05. Not the best part of Rome but only a short walk from the Termini, 5 minutes maximum. First impression ok, but a rather grumpy individual checked us in. It felt like we were an inconvenience! All we were told was our room #, where the lift was and the time of breakfast (forget it, a complete waste of effort getting up for that). Room clean, but we ordered a double and it was a twin. Complained at reception but he told me "no doubles, all rooms are twins, if you want a double the beds are moved together". The view from window awful, we were in the middle overlooking air conditioning units etc. Bathroom ok but be careful with the shower, no cutain and the water goes all over the tiled floor, therefore very slippery when wet. Weather was great, but air conditioning did not seem to work, hot air blown out on both settings. The in room fridge was handy as was the safe (no charge for either). A lovely city but service very poor! Hotel staff and most restaurants, bars etc could do with a training session in the States.

Reviews.Title: “Only for school trips”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was disappoined with this hotel. The rooms were basic and not very clean. The staff were unhelpful and some were ignorant. There are no guides or information about the city and the staff look at you like you're stupid for even asking about Rome! Breakfast was simple and the bread tasted stale so we went out for breakfast to the Piazza Republica most days. There were school parties staying during my visit which was annoying as I got many phone calls at 3am and had to listen to them screaming and running up and down the corridors/stairs all night! They seemed to love it though so if you're looking for somewhere to take students in Rome you'll do Ok here! Its in a seedy part of the city the only good thing being the short distance to the Termini station.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel at all”
Reviews.Author: rcohoon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group of students--I was the leader. The hotel is 4 star and the area is super. It's right next to Termini train station and there are at least 7 internet/phone establishments within 2 blocks as well as tons of restaurants and cafes. Lobby is really pretty and rooms are nicely appointed. The only disappointment is air conditioning was cool only intermittently and it was really hot in Rome. Breakfast was plentiful and fresh with coffee machines, juice, breads, cereals, cheeses and cold cuts. I would have to recommend this hotel because of its location and cleanliness. Staff was helpful for us but not overly friendly.

HotelInfo.Name: Noto Rome
HotelInfo.Address: Via Calatafimi 12, 00185 Rome, Italy
